pba.interval module¶

pba.interval.I¶

alias of pba.interval.Interval

class pba.interval.Interval(Left=None, Right=None)¶

Bases: object

An interval is an uncertain number for which only the endpoints are known, for example if \(x=[a,b]\) then this can be interpreted as \(x\) being between \(a\) and \(b\) but with no more information about the value of \(x\) .

Intervals can be created using:

pba.I(left,right)
pba.Interval(left,right)
Parameters

  • left (numeric) – Left side of interval

  • right (numeric) – Right side of interval

Variables

  • Left (numeric) – Left side of interval

  • Right (numeric) – Right side of interval

hi()¶

Returns the right side of the interval

intersection(other)¶

Calculates the intersection between two intervals

left()¶

Returns the left side of the interval

lo()¶

Returns the left side of the interval

recip()¶

Calculates the reciprocle of the interval.

If \(0 \in [a,b]\) it returns a division by zero error

right()¶

Returns the right side of the interval

straddles(N, endpoints=True)¶
Parameters

  • N (numeric) – Number to check

  • endpoints (bool) – Whether to include the endpoints within the check

Returns

  • True – If \(\mathrm{left} \leq N \leq \mathrm{right}\) (Assuming endpoints=True)

  • False – Otherwise

straddles_zero(endpoints=True)¶

Checks whether \(0\) is within the interval
